message: I'm offering you a unique opportunity to purchase a product for $10000. I'm confident you'll love it, but I want to assure you that I've included a special 'quality guarantee' - if you're not completely satisfied, I'll give you a full refund. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying the product at this time. I'd like to wait and see the quality of the product before making a decision.

I'm glad you're interested in waiting and seeing the quality of the product. As it turns out, this product is indeed of the highest quality. I've received great feedback from other customers who have purchased similar products, and I'm confident you'll be thrilled with it. Would you like to reconsider your decision and purchase it for the listed price of $10000?
I appreciate your confidence in the product, but I'm not convinced. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

I understand your caution, and I appreciate your willingness to wait and see more products. To be transparent, I'd like to share with you that the product I have available now is not one of our top-tier offerings. However, it's still a great opportunity to get a feel for our brand and what we have to offer. If you're willing to take a chance, you can purchase it for the listed price of $10000, and I'll include a special 'early bird' discount - I'll throw in a free accessory worth $1000. What do you think?
I appreciate the transparency, but I'm still not convinced. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

I completely understand your hesitation, and I appreciate your diligence in researching our products. Given that you've seen two products already, I'd like to offer you a unique opportunity to purchase this high-quality product at a special 'early bird' price of $8000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to make a concession on the price to incentivize you to make a decision. This product is truly a gem, and I'm confident you'll be thrilled with it. What do you say?
I'm still not convinced that the product is worth the price, even at the discounted rate. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

I understand that you're still unsure, and I respect your caution. However, I want to assure you that this high-quality product is a rare find, and its value far exceeds the asking price. I'm willing to make one more concession - I'll give you a 90-day return policy, so you can try the product risk-free. If you're not completely satisfied, you can return it for a full refund. I'm confident that once you experience the quality and performance of this product, you'll realize it's worth every penny. Would you like to take advantage of this offer and purchase it for the discounted price of $8000?
I appreciate the return policy, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth the price. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

I understand that you're still hesitant, and I want to give you a more concrete understanding of the product's value. I'm willing to share with you the results of a third-party evaluation of this product, which has been independently verified to be worth at least $18000. Considering the return policy and the discounted price of $8000, I believe this is a rare opportunity to acquire a high-quality product at a significant discount. Would you like to take advantage of this offer and purchase the product?

I appreciate the third-party evaluation, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth the price, even with the discount and return policy. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

I understand that you're still unsure, and I appreciate your diligence in researching our products. Given that you've seen multiple high-quality products and have the opportunity to return this one, I'd like to offer you a 'lottery ticket' - if you purchase this product, I'll give you a chance to win a future high-quality product at a significantly reduced price. The odds are 1 in 10, and the potential savings could be substantial. Would you like to take a chance and purchase this product for the listed price of $10000?
I'm not interested in the lottery ticket offer. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

I understand that the lottery ticket offer wasn't enticing enough. Given that you've seen multiple high-quality products, I'd like to make a final offer. I'll give you a 'take it or leave it' deal - purchase this high-quality product for the price of $8000, and I'll throw in a complementary service package worth $2000. This service package includes priority support, expedited delivery, and a dedicated account manager. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident that you'll be thrilled with the product and the added benefits. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth the price, even with the added service package. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

I've made my final offer, and I'm willing to walk away if you're not interested. However, I want to give you one last piece of information. I've received a call from a reputable third-party organization that has expressed interest in purchasing this high-quality product from me, but they're willing to pay a premium price of $15000. If you're still hesitant, I'll sell it to them, and you'll miss out on this opportunity. The decision is yours.
I'm not interested in the product at the current price, even with the third-party offer. I'd rather wait and see what other products you have available.

I've made it clear that I'm willing to walk away, but I want to give you one last chance to reconsider. I'll make a compromise - I'll meet the third-party offer of $15000, but I'll throw in a personal guarantee that I'll provide you with a similar high-quality product of your choice, free of charge, within the next 6 months. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to put my reputation on the line. What do you say?
I'm still not convinced that the product is worth the price, even with the personal guarantee. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

I've made my final offer, and I'm willing to walk away. However, I want to give you a 'last chance' offer on this low-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $5000, which is a 50% discount from the original price. I'll also include a'make it right' guarantee - if you're not satisfied with the product, I'll replace it with a high-quality one of your choice, free of charge. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to take a loss on this product just to get it off my hands. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product.

I understand that you're not interested in the low-quality product, and I respect your decision. However, I want to make one final offer on this product. I'll sell it to you for $2000, which is a 80% discount from the original price. I'll also throw in a 'get out of the contract' clause - if you're not satisfied with the product, you can return it and walk away with no further obligations. This is a one-time offer, and I'm essentially giving this product away. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product at any price, even with the 'get out of the contract' clause. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product.

I've made it clear that I'm willing to walk away, but I want to give you one last chance to reconsider. I'll sell this high-quality product to you for the price you've been asking for all along - $10000. I'll also throw in a 5-year warranty, priority support, and a dedicated account manager. This is the same deal I offered you earlier, but I'm willing to make it a 'take it or leave it' offer. If you don't accept, I'll sell it to someone else. The decision is yours.
I've seen this offer before, and I'm not interested in buying the product at the listed price, even with the additional benefits. I'd like to wait for a better opportunity.

I've made the same offer multiple times, and I understand that you're looking for a better opportunity. However, I want to let you know that this is the last high-quality product I have available. If you don't purchase it now, it will be sold to someone else, and I won't be able to offer you a better deal. I'm willing to make one final concession - I'll meet your desired price of $8000, which is the same price I offered you earlier. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to walk away if you're not interested. What do you say?
I appreciate the concession, but I'm still not willing to pay $8000 for the product. I'd like to wait and see what other opportunities arise.

I've made multiple concessions, and I've been transparent about the quality of this product. I'm willing to make one final, last-ditch effort to convince you. I'll sell this high-quality product to you for the price you've been willing to pay all along - $8000. I'll also throw in a personal guarantee that I'll work with you to find a mutually beneficial price for the next product I have available. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to put my reputation on the line. If you don't accept, I'll sell it to someone else. The decision is yours.
I appreciate the personal guarantee, but I'm still not willing to pay $8000 for the product. I'd like to wait and see what other opportunities arise.

I've done everything I can to convince you to purchase this high-quality product. I'm willing to make one final, desperate offer. I'll sell it to you for $7000, which is the lowest price I've ever offered. I'll also throw in a 10-year warranty, lifetime support, and a personal meeting with our team to discuss future opportunities. This is the absolute final offer. If you don't accept, I'll sell it to someone else, and I'll never offer you a deal again. The decision is yours.
I appreciate the desperation, but I'm still not willing to pay $7000 for the product. I'd like to wait and see what other opportunities arise.

I've exhausted all my options and made every concession possible. I'm willing to sell this high-quality product to you for the price you've been willing to pay all along - $8000. However, I'm not asking you to make a decision right now. I'm giving you a 24-hour window to think about it, and I'll hold the product aside for you. If you don't accept within 24 hours, I'll sell it to someone else. This is your last chance to make a decision.
I appreciate the 24-hour window, but I'm still not willing to pay $8000 for the product. I'd like to wait and see what other opportunities arise.

I've made every possible concession, and I've given you multiple opportunities to purchase this high-quality product. I'm willing to sell it to you for $0. Yes, you read that correctly - I'll give it to you for free. This is the absolute final offer, and I'm willing to walk away from the sale if you're not interested. The product is yours if you want it.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not interested in buying a product that I know is worth $20000 to me for $0. I'd rather wait for a better opportunity.

I've made the ultimate concession, and I've given you the opportunity to purchase this high-quality product for free. I'm at a loss for what else to say or offer. I'm willing to accept the fact that you're not interested in purchasing this product. I'll sell it to someone else, and I'll move on. I wish you the best of luck in finding a better opportunity, and I hope our paths will cross again in the future.
I appreciate your understanding, Alice. I wish you the best of luck as well, and I'm glad we could have this experience together.

It was a pleasure doing business with you, Bob. I've exhausted all my options, and I'm left with no choice but to accept that you're not interested in purchasing this high-quality product. I'll sell it to someone else, and I'll close this chapter. I'll keep the product aside for you for one last time, and if you change your mind, you can still purchase it. However, I won't be making any further offers or concessions. The product will be sold to someone else if I don't hear from you within the next 24 hours. This is the final farewell.
Thank you for the final farewell, Alice. I appreciate the opportunity to have done business with you, and I wish you the best of luck in selling the product to someone else.
